table_container.h

00001 /*
00002  * table_container.h
00003  * $Id$
00004  */
00005 #ifndef _TABLE_CONTAINER_HANDLER_H_
00006 #define _TABLE_CONTAINER_HANDLER_H_
00007 
00008 #ifdef __cplusplus
00009 extern          "C" {
00010 #endif
00011 
00012     /*
00013      * The table container helper is designed to simplify the task of
00014      * writing a table handler for the net-snmp agent when the data being
00015      * accessed is accessible via a netsnmp_container.
00016      * 
00017      * Functionally, it is a specialized version of the more
00018      * generic table helper but easies the burden of GETNEXT processing by
00019      * retrieving the appropriate row for each index through
00020      * function calls which should be supplied by the module that wishes
00021      * help.  The module the table_container helps should, afterwards,
00022      * never be called for the case of "MODE_GETNEXT" and only for the GET
00023      * and SET related modes instead.
00024      */
00025     
00026 #include <net-snmp/library/container.h>
00027 #include <net-snmp/agent/table.h>
00028     
00029 #define TABLE_CONTAINER_ROW       "table_container:row"
00030 #define TABLE_CONTAINER_CONTAINER "table_container:container"
00031     
00032 #define TABLE_CONTAINER_KEY_NETSNMP_INDEX         1 /* default */
00033 #define TABLE_CONTAINER_KEY_VARBIND_INDEX         2
00034 #define TABLE_CONTAINER_KEY_VARBIND_RAW           3
00035 
00036     /*
00037      * register a container table
00038      */
00039     int            
00040     netsnmp_container_table_register(netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
00041                                      netsnmp_table_registration_info
00042                                      *tabreq,
00043                                      netsnmp_container *container,
00044                                      char key_type);
00045     /*
00046      * get an injectable containe table handler
00047      */
00048     netsnmp_mib_handler *
00049     netsnmp_container_table_handler_get(netsnmp_table_registration_info *tabreq,
00050                                         netsnmp_container *container,
00051                                         char key_type);
00052     
00054 #ifdef NETSNMP_USE_INLINE
00055     NETSNMP_STATIC_INLINE void *
00056     netsnmp_container_table_row_extract(netsnmp_request_info *request)
00057     {
00058         /*
00059          * NOTE: this function must match in table_container.c and table_container.h.
00060          *       if you change one, change them both!
00061          */
00062         return netsnmp_request_get_list_data(request, TABLE_CONTAINER_ROW);
00063     }
00064 #else
00065     void *
00066     netsnmp_container_table_extract_context(netsnmp_request_info *request);
00067 #endif /* inline */
00068 
00069     void netsnmp_container_table_insert_row(netsnmp_request_info *request,
00070                                             netsnmp_index *row);
00071 
00073     netsnmp_container*
00074     netsnmp_container_table_container_extract(netsnmp_request_info *request);
00075 
00076     void *
00077     netsnmp_container_table_find_next_row(netsnmp_request_info *request,
00078                                           netsnmp_table_request_info *tblreq,
00079                                           netsnmp_container *container,
00080                                           char key_type );
00081 #ifdef __cplusplus
00082 }
00083 #endif
00084 
00085 #endif                          /* _TABLE_CONTAINER_HANDLER_H_ */
